p: NS1 treatment of proliferating TIME cells significantly induced the expressions of HAS1, HAS2 and HAS3, as well as HYAL1, but had no effect on the intrinsic constitutively high transcription of HYAL2 and CD44 ( Fig. 2 b). Notably, the induction of HAS2 transcription was more profound than HAS1 and HAS3 after 24â€¯h of exposure to NS1, and was accompanied by increased HAS2 protein expression ( Fig. 2 b, Fig. S2, e and f).
